Description: HTAN ID associated with a patient based on HTAN ID SOP (eg HTANx_yyy )

An individual's self-described social and cultural grouping, specifically whether an individual describes themselves as Hispanic or Latino. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.
Valid Values: hispanic or latino not hispanic or latino unknown Not Reported not allowed to collect

Description: Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. [Identification of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire, interview, etc.]
Valid Values: Female Male unknown Unspecified Not Reported

Description: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of a species. It usually arises as a consequence of geographical isolation withina a species and is characterized by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in the case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution.
Valid Values: white american indian or alaska native black or african american asian native hawaiian or other pacific islander Other unknown Not Reported not allowed to collect

Description: The survival state of the person registered on the protocol.
Number of days between the date used for index and the date from a person's date of birth represented as a calculated negative number of days. If not applicable please enter 'Not Applicable'

Description: The age of the patient has been modified for compliance reasons. The actual age differs from what is reported. Other date intervals for this patient may also be modified.
Numeric value to represent the calendar year in which an individual was born.
The number of years a patient worked in a specific occupation.
The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient was premature (less than 37 weeks gestation) at birth.
Numeric value used to describe the number of weeks starting from the approximate date of the biological mother's last menstrual period and ending with the birth of the patient.
This indicates the participant is dead and defines further required metadata
Numeric value to represent the year of the death of an individual.

Valid Values: Cancer Related Cardiovascular Disorder NOS End-stage Renal Disease Infection Not Cancer Related Renal Disorder NOS Spinal Muscular Atrophy Surgical Complications Toxicity Not Reported unknown Not Applicable

Description: The text term used to describe the source used to determine the patient's cause of death.
Valid Values: Autopsy Death Certificate Medical Record Social Security Death Index Obituary unknown Not Reported

Description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date from a person's date of death represented as a calculated number of days. If not applicable please enter 'Not Applicable'
This indicates the participant is alive and defines further required metadata
Number of days between the date used for index and the reference date for designation of vital status
